1.description: Prized for its incredible fragrance, award-winning Philadelphus is a compact medium-sized deciduous shrub of great beauty when in bloom. In late spring to early summer, its elegantly arching branches bear a profusion of large, highly-scented, single white flowers

2.description: Noted for its outstanding color and vigor, award-winning Acer palmatum is a medium-sized deciduous shrub with large, deeply cut, dissected leaves of great beauty. In spring, it produces small purple flowers which give way to red fruits.

3.description: Extremely showy, Bougainvillea is a free-flowering, vigorous, evergreen shrub or vine with clusters of fiery fuchsia-red, papery bracts surrounding tiny creamy-white flowers. Blooming periodically throughout the year in warm winter areas.

4.description: Fast-growing, Liriodendron is an upright, spreading deciduous tree. In late spring to early summer, tulip-shaped, yellowish-green flowers, 4 cm long. Emerging burgundy, they turn green before changing to a brilliant golden yellow in fall.

5.description: Strelitzia brings a sensational tropical accent in the garden or in a sunny interior room. This evergreen perennial forms a clump of large, gray-green leaves, contrast nicely with brilliant orange and vivid blue flowers, resembling the crest on a bird's head.
